job_description:
Job Title: Event Sponsorship Manager

Job Description: Under the supervision of the Executive Director of Marketing & Programs,

the full-time Sponsorship Sales Executive is responsible for the development, implementation, and fulfillment of all sponsorship sales at the El Paso Chamber. This key role is responsible for establishing the strategies and philosophies that will drive the sales team and plans to achieve targeted revenue objectives, ensuring that decisions drive the long-term success of the El Paso Chamber.

Pay range: $42,000.00 - $50,000.00 annually plus commission.

Primary Responsibilities:

· Create sponsorship opportunities (event marketing packages) for special events/programs, and cultivate, procure and manage sponsors, partners, and display vendors.

· Cultivate and manage strong business relationships with current and potential sponsors.

· Meet and exceed projections, schedules, and timelines provided by the Director of Membership.

· Identify and prioritize sponsorship opportunities.

· Manage Sponsor, Partner, and Vendor relationships via quality communication, gifts, and other incentives.

· Contact prospective companies and individuals to initiate the sales effort. Follow up on leads generated by outside sources.

· Schedule meetings and prepare, customize, and present sponsorship sales proposals to potential sponsors.

· Negotiate and compile sales contracts and agreements.

· Deliver requested information to potential sponsors in a timely manner.

· Assist in the preparation and design of sponsorship sales brochures, pamphlets, advertisements, or other sales materials.

· Support and participate in business and industry related events to include networking opportunities.

· Participate in and attend industry workshops and seminars.

· Work extended and/or irregular hours including nights, weekends, as needed.

· Other duties as assigned.

Additional Responsibilities:

· Attend staff meetings, including other meetings as requested.

· Network with staff in related industries such as hospitality, events, and tourism.

· Attend community events.

· Positively promote all El Paso Chamber programs and events.

· Effective communication skills and development of good working relationships with staff, prospective, existing clients, and strategic partners.

· Achievement of objectives as set in the Sales Plan, within the established timelines.

· Increase community engagement and brand awareness.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Preferred:

· Customer service mindset.

· Creative and decisive.

· Effective communication and relationship-building skills.

· Independent worker with limited supervision needed.

· Strong time management, organizational, and project management skills.

· Able to multitask on a regular basis.

· Comfortable and successful working with diverse groups of people.

El Paso Chamber Core Values:

· A commitment to excellence

· Dedication to service to our members

· Respect for everyone in the community

· Understanding that as a non-profit, we are held in the public’s trust.

Qualifications:

· Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited four-year university or college

· Bilingual preferred

· Strong verbal presentation and written skills with the proven ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.

· Able to accurately solve problems, exceptional proficiency in data management, and effective, careful use of resources.

· Proficiency in the use and application of the following software: Required: Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, and Outlook). Preferred: QuickBooks, PowerPoint, and Adobe.

· Must be willing to undergo a background screening.

Benefits:

· 401(k)

· 401(k) matching

· Health insurance

· Paid time

Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited four-year university or college
Strong verbal presentation and written skills with the proven ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships
Able to accurately solve problems, exceptional proficiency in data management, and effective, careful use of resources
